intro: Pimpinella ledermannii subsp. engleriana, commonly known as the Engler's cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
